channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Coronavirus Wales: Hundreds attend 36-hour illegal rave party
item.description: Some 3,000 revellers descended on an area of woodland near the village of Banwen on the early hours of Sunday morning - with 400 ravers still at the site by Monday evening. It has now been shut down.

item.title: Declan Donnelly reveals he almost QUIT showbiz aged 11
item.description: Declan Donnelly, 44, has revealed that he wanted to quit acting aged 11 and become a priest when he was turned down for the lead role in the kids' show Geordie Racer.

item.title: Eat Out to Help Out scheme is set to smash 80million-meal barrier tonight at £400m cost to taxpayer
item.description: Diners have endured three hour queues for their final 50% discounts of up to £10 per head which have been offered at restaurants across the country since the beginning of August.

item.title: Lone Channel swimmer is found by passing vessel after eight-hour search
item.description: A helicopter and rescue teams were dispatched to the sea off Kent after the coastguard received a call from a member of the public saying a friend was trying to cross to France.

item.title: Late eaters are more likely to gain weight, study finds
item.description: Researchers from Ulster University in Northern Ireland surveyed almost 1,200 people and found that those who were later eaters ended up eating more overall and it tended to be less healthy.

item.title: Extinction Rebellion activists hold dinner party in SEA off Essex
item.description: Climate activists wearing fine dining dress waded into the water off Chalkwell Beach, Southend-on-Sea, to quaff Champagne and sip tea around a semi-submerged table.

item.title: Are YOU getting the right pills to help beat crippling gout?
item.description: For seven years, Sue McDonagh struggled with gout attacks so intense, it felt as though shards of glass were pressing into her right big toe, and at one point had her begging for an amputation.

item.title: Leeds and Reading Festival 2021: Headline acts confirmed
item.description: Leeds and Reading Festival confirmed to return in 2021 with a host of big names performing including Liam Gallagher, Stormzy, Post Malone, Lewis Capaldi, Disclosure and more.

item.title: Porn actor Ron Jeremy charged with 20 new counts of sex abuse including assault of teen and 12 more
item.description: Adult film performer Ron Jeremy has been charged with sexually assaulting a 15-year-old girl and a dozen more women, Los Angeles prosecutors said Monday.

item.title: Health chief in low-risk city tells pupils and school staff to wear face masks in communal areas
item.description: Instead of leaving the decision to head teachers, Greg Fell, the director of public health in Sheffield, has advised all secondary schools, colleges and universities to implement the safety-first policy.

item.title: How virus-proof is your mask? Under laboratory conditions, a professor answers the burning question
item.description: Face coverings may be compulsory in more places now than ever - but how much protection do they really afford to people around you? Professor Val Edwards-Jones is pictured above testing masks.

item.title: Bloomin' heck! Plants can see, hear and CHAT
item.description: Scientists are discovering more all the time about the ability of plants to 'hear', 'talk', 'count', 'remember', spot 'regional accents' and even size up opponents.

item.title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Cara Delevingne is left 'devastated' by death of her godmother
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Friends of the effervescent Annette 'Scruff' Howard, Cara Delevingne's godmother, are in mourning today, following her death aged 71.

item.title: Trump hits back at Biden saying 'he's blaming the police more than rioters'
item.description: President Trump accused Joe Biden of 'blaming the police' after Biden delivered a speech blasting Trump for escalating the violence between cops, protesters and his supporters.

item.title: Canary Island hit by coronavirus second wave of at least 40 new cases
item.description: El Hierro previously registered only a handful of cases and no deaths. But a second wave of the virus has left at least 40 people infected - prompting local authorities to take urgent action.

item.title: Why are patients STILL at risk from stem cell jabs?
item.description: JOHN NAISH: Princess Michael of Kent appeared in a promotional video for a clinic in the Bahamas that offers stem cell therapy for problem joints such as her painful shoulder.

item.title: Prince George, 7, watches dad William on Balmoral grouse shoot
item.description: The seven-year-old watched as Prince William, 38, and other senior royals spent the morning bagging birds in Corgarff, a short drive from Balmoral, on Saturday. (George is pictured in July)

item.title: Boris Johnson poaches Prince William's aide for civil service
item.description: Whitehall sources last night confirmed that Boris Johnson has picked Prince William's former aide Simon Case to be the UK's new Cabinet Secretary.

item.title: Coronavirus Scotland: Pupils wear face masks at school
item.description: Staff have described their sleepless nights over a lack of PPE and no enforced social distancing in schools - with teacher one saying the fear took such a toll she was forced to take antidepressants.

item.title: NORMAN LAMONT advises Rishi Sunak on lockdown funding
item.description: NORMAN LAMONT: The job of Chancellor of the Exchequer is always one of the most difficult in Government. Rishi Sunak has faced a bigger challenge than any other modern Chancellor.

item.title: Michel Barnier jets into London to break Brexit deal deadlock
item.description: EU chief negotiator Michel Barnier will travel to London for the talks with David Frost in a bid to break the deadlock. The discussions are expected to focus on state aid rules and fishing rights.

item.title: Kanye West denies rumors Trump and GOP are bankrolling his White House bid
item.description: Kanye West sought to quash speculation that Republicans are paying him to run as a distraction to bolster President Trump's chances at re-election in an interview with Nick Cannon.

item.title: Portland man 'under investigation' for shooting Trump supporter
item.description: Michael Forest Reinoehl, 48, was identified by anonymous police sources cited by The Oregonian. His sister identified him to police after she saw photos of him online.

item.title: The coronavirus pandemic has led to a dramatic rise in private planes
item.description: Air Charter Service, the world's largest aircraft charter broker, reports a 93 per cent rise in new customer inquiries. Here, SADIE NICHOLAS speaks to four lucky holidaymakers.

item.title: Can BA fly high again? Airline burning through £20m of cash every day
item.description: Parent company IAG made a £3.8bn loss in the first half of this year. It is trying to raise just under £2.5bn of capital from shareholders including Qatar Airways, which owns 25 per cent.

item.title: Hotel Rwanda hero who saved 1,200 lives during country's 1994 genocide is arrested on terror charges
item.description: Paul Rusesabagina, 66, who was portrayed as a hero in the film, has been arrested by the Rwandan government on terror charges, police announced on Monday. He has not been charged in court yet.

item.title: Forbes Celebrity 100: Netflix paid $540m to top actors in 4 years
item.description: In the past year alone Netflix, Apple and Amazon paid top grossing stars $300million, according to Forbes 2020 Celebrity 100 list, with Netflix shelling out two thirds of that amount.

item.title: Flu vaccine during pregnancy has NO link to a baby's risk of developing autism, study confirms
item.description: Researchers from the Karolinska Institutet in Stockholm, Sweden, studied birth records of 69,000 children born between 2009 and 2010 and found autism was lower in the vaccine group.

item.title: Big increase in tax evasion whistleblowers: Number of tip offs up 10%
item.description: Accounting group UHY Hacker Young, which compiled the data, said the rise was partly down to tax evasion increasingly being seen as unacceptable behaviour.

item.title: Bank of Mum and Dad gets busy raising deposits for young home buyers
item.description: A survey by insurance giant Legal & General and the Centre for Economics and Business Research has found almost one in four purchases this year will be backed by parents, family and friends.

item.title: Rishi's grants for furloughed employees won't save jobs, warn bosses
item.description: The chancellor Rishi Sunak is offering employers a £1,000 grant for every furloughed employee they keep on when the job retention scheme winds down at the end of October.

item.title: Morrison's worker is sacked after calling a shopper a 'black c***'
item.description: The employee hurled racist abuse at the black customer as security held the man back and staff tried to restrain the worker who kept screaming in a store in Palmers Green, London.

item.title: Terry Christian blasts BBC for 'fetishising' World War Two before Laurence Fox hits back
item.description: Some people agreed saying the 'right is obsessed with the glorification of WW2' but many slammed him for using the freedom their grandfathers died for to 'slam the country'.

item.title: Homeless people sleep on makeshift mattresses and cardboard boxes in Park Lane
item.description: More than twenty men and women set up makeshift beds out of cardboard and dumped mattresses in front of a set of shops on Park Lane last night, metres from a string of five-star hotels.

item.title: How you can enjoy 48 days off work using just 18 days of annual leave
item.description: Instant Office has revealed how you can beat the system to cash in on almost double the number of days off next year - by extending your annual leave with bank holidays.

item.title: Grand Designs: Home that caused five heart bypasses on sale
item.description: The spectacular glass villa, known as 'The Curve', is nestled north of Brighton and boasts stunning views across the countryside thanks to floor-to-ceiling windows throughout its five bedrooms.

item.title: Harry Dunn's family DROP plan to sue US government
item.description: Charlotte Charles and Tim Dunn previously said they would pursue a claim against Donald Trump's administration for its handling of their son's case.

item.title: Mariah Carey 'wasn't ready' to announce pregnancy on Ellen show
item.description: Mariah Carey discussed an 'extremely uncomfortable' 2008 appearance on the Ellen DeGeneres Show where the host tried to force her to reveal she was pregnant.

item.title: Ministers play down prospect of coronavirus testing at airports
item.description: There were 21.1 coronavirus cases per 100,000 people in the country over the seven days to August 30 - up from 19.4 in the week to August 29.

item.title: Body found in hunt for UK diplomat missing after going for run
item.description: Richard Morris, 52, was last seen on the morning of May 6 after leaving his £1m detached home in the village of Bentley, near Alton, Hants, to go running.

item.title: TikTok has chosen US bidder to buy the company, sources say
item.description: TikTok has reportedly chosen a bidder for the sale of its US arm and the deal could be announced as early as tomorrow, sources told CNBC on Monday.

item.title: Meteorite chunks worth up to £20,000 each fall on Brazil town
item.description: As many as 200 fragments of the meteorite, which fell on August 19, have been found so far in Santa Filomena, northeastern Brazil.

item.title: Footballer 'killed 'devoted' married couple in M56 truck crash'
item.description: Bennett, 28, admitted his careless driving caused the deaths of Richard and Angela Wong after he was involved in the multi-vehicle accident near Warrington last September.

item.title: Coronavirus cases in Scotland hit a three month high
item.description: In the last 24 hours, 160 new cases of Covid-19 have been recorded north of the border with Ms Sturgeon insisting Scotland is in a 'fragile position' after loosening lockdown rules.

item.title: Being selfish doesn't get you ahead even in a dog-eat-dog workplace, study finds
item.description: University of California, Berkeley researchers asked 450 students to fill in personality surveys - then did the same a decade later also examining their career progress.

item.title: Pills to lower blood pressure can prevent heart attacks even in HEALTHY people
item.description: In the biggest study of its kind, Oxford University researchers found lowering levels even from a healthy starting point slashed the risk of heart disease and strokes by up to 13 per cent years down the line.

item.title: St Louis lawyer couple who aimed guns at BLM protesters appear in court
item.description: Mark and Patricia McCloskey appeared in St Louis court on Monday. They are both charged with felony unlawful use of a weapon stemming from the June 28 incident outside their home.
item.media:description: Mark and Patricia McCloskey listen to their attorney Joel Schwartz address the media as they leave court after a first appearance on felony weapons charges on Monday, Aug. 31, 2020, in St. Louis, Mo. The couple were charged in July with one felony count of unlawful use of a weapon - exhibiting, after they confronted protesters who were marching through their private street en route to Mayor Lyda Krewson's house in June. (Robert Cohen/St. Louis Post-Dispatch via AP)

item.title: Amazon gets FAA approval to test US Prime Air delivery drones
item.description: Amazon first revealed its Prime Air delivery drones in 2013, but has now won approval from the FAA to test its service in the US. It will start in low populated and deliver packages five pounds or less.

item.title: Battery encased in diamonds is powered by nuclear waste that could last for THOUSANDS of years
item.description: A California startup is one-step closer to designing a battery that lasts for thousands of years on a single charge. The design is fueled by nuclear wasted and encased in diamonds..

item.title: One of UK's oldest horse-drawn barges forced to stop river trips
item.description: Jenny Roberts, who has run river trips on the Iona for the last 35 years says she was forced to close her business after heavy criticism from 'snowflake' canal users near the River Wey in Surrey.

item.title: Melania Trump 'rolled eyes' when Donald talked of Presidency
item.description: Melania Trump would roll her eyes whenever Ivanka would talk about being America's first female president, a source connected to a bombshell book told DailyMail.com.

item.title: Melania Trump's 'laughed about 'grab em by the p***y' tape'
item.description: Melania Trump's former friend, Stephanie Winston Wolkoff, said she and the first lady laughed during the 2016 campaign after the infamous 'Access Hollywood' tape came out.

item.title: Paedophiles are using cheese and pizza emojis to communicate secretly on Instagram
item.description: The emojis have been used to identify thousands of potential paedophile accounts on social media that are accessing explicit images of children. More than 2,000 have already been shut down.

item.title: Horror stories emerge from lockdown in China's Xinjiang region
item.description: The Xinjiang region has resorted to draconian measures to combat Covid, with authorities locking residents inside their homes and enforcing longer quarantines for those who don't comply.
item.media:description: This August 2020, photo provided by a Uighur under quarantine shows a bottle of unidentified traditional Chinese medicine in Urumqi, China. As parts of the Xinjiang region in China's far northwest enters the 45th day of a second grueling lockdown due to a coronavirus outbreak, the government there is coercing some residents into using traditional Chinese medicine despite a lack of rigorous clinical data proving it works. (AP Photo)

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Two new deaths in daily toll
item.description: The two Covid-19 deaths in English hospitals take the total to 41,501 but focus is shifting now to rising numbers of infections which are at a 12-week high across the UK.

item.title: Police want to find two boys who helped pull bin bags containing human remains from Suffolk river
item.description: Police are trying to find two boys who helped pull two bin bags filled with human bones from the River Stour, near Sudbury, on Thursday.

item.title: Princess Märtha Louise praises 'beautiful' daughter Leah on her confirmation
item.description: Princess Märtha Louise of Norway, 38, shared her congratulations for her teenage daughter Leah, 15, in a gushing Instagram post and said her late ex-husband would have been 'so proud'.

item.title: Brazilian indigenous leader, 89, who fights for preservation of Amazon tests positive for Covid-19
item.description: Raoni, who is nearly 90, has been a fierce critics of Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro's calls for the economic development of Indigenous land in the Amazon rainforest.
item.media:description: FILE - In this Aug. 26, 2019 file photo, Kayapo tribal leader Raoni Metuktire smokes a pipe after a press conference in Bidart, southwestern France. The Indigenous leader emblematic of the fight for the preservation of the Amazon forest in Brazil was hospitalized with symptoms of pneumonia and tested positive for the new coronavirus, according to the Raoni Institute on Monday, Aug. 31, 2020. (AP Photo/Bob Edme, File)

item.title: Face mask sales surge in Sweden after country warned it may advise people to wear them in
item.description: Unlike most other European countries, Sweden has kept many businesses, restaurants and most schools open, while not recommending the use of face masks.

item.title: Coronavirus could affect your testicles: Man, 37, suffers swelling and 'discomfort' in his scrotum
item.description: Doctors from San Antonio in Texas said the virus had damaged his spermatocytes, which keep sperm healthy. They warned it could lead to fertility issues.

item.title: TUI passenger on Zante flight claims 'inept' crew did nothing as flyers took off masks
item.description: Stephanie Whitfield, who was on TUI flight 6215 to Cardiff from the Greek holiday resort, claimed crew 'couldn't care less' about covid rules after sixteen passengers fell ill.

item.title: Savvy mum shares how she feeds her family of four for just £47 a month
item.description: Mary Bells, from Torquay, Devon, posted a picture to Extreme Couponing and Bargains UK Facebook Group and showed off her impressive array of batch cooked dinners which feed her husband and kids.

item.title: Coronavirus US: Maine wedding now linked to 123 cases
item.description: Maine officials said that 123 COVID-19 cases have been linked to an indoor wedding in Millinocket. One woman died after being infected by a guest and the outbreak spread to other towns.

item.title: Woman learns of boyfriend's infidelity via note left on her car
item.description: An unidentified woman received a devastating note from her neighbor revealing that her boyfriend had cheated - and criticizing her for her dirty car.

item.title: Far-right councillor wants his town to become 'whites only' as he launches campaign
item.description: Councillor Julian Leppert, alongside former BNP campaign chief Eddy Butler, of the For Britain party launched a campaign against the Home Office temporarily housing asylum seekers.

item.title: Another 16 workers test positive for Covid at chicken factory
item.description: Banham Poultry in the village of Attleborough voluntarily agreed to close its cutting room last Friday following an outbreak of the disease.

item.title: Arthritis drug may help coronavirus patients by calming deadly inflammatory cytokine storms
item.description: A new study found that tocilizumab helped decrease levels of PAI-1, a protein which causes small blood clots in vessels throughout the body, including the lungs, in coronavirus patients.

item.title: Lottery winner who scooped £2.7m jackpot 25 years ago is still stacking shelves at M&S
item.description: Lottery winner Elaine Thompson, 64, from Killingworth, north Tyneside, works at Marks & Spencer, starting her shifts at 2am and finishing at 9am.

item.title: Which? finds M&S cheaper than Waitrose ahead of Ocado launch
item.description: M&S has dropped prices to undercut its upmarket rival on thousands of items such as tinned tomatoes and organic cucumbers ahead of its tie-up with Ocado, which launches tomorrow.

item.title: Mother stuns onlookers with uncanny resemblance to Kendall Jenner
item.description: Teona Chachua, 29, from Tbilisi, Georgia, never realised just how much she looked like the reality TV star until she started beauty blogging in 2018, and was inundated by fans of the model.

item.title: Grandmother, 71, in tears after finally receiving diagnosis for unexplained condition
item.description: Judy, 71, from Kent, appeared on BBC2 show The Diagnosis Detectives, where she received a diagnosis for an unexplained condition for over ten years and left her 'skin and bones'.

item.title: Katy Perry shows off post-baby body five days after giving birth
item.description: MTV held their first virtual Video Music Award ceremony on Sunday, which honored the visual works produced by some of the biggest names in music.

item.title: Britain's first black chief constable warns George Floyd-style killing could happen in UK
item.description: Michael Fuller, former Kent Police chief constable, said there is no evidence to prove that stop and search is effective in reducing crime, pointing out that 80 per cent of people stopped are innocent.

item.title: Squatters 'use gym and pool' at EuroMillions winner Adrian Bayford's empty £6.5million mansion
item.description: Adrian Bayford has now had to increase security at the £6.5million Grade II manor house in Linton, Cambridgeshire after intruders started using the impressive home for themselves.

item.title: Police clash with BLM protesters outside the White House for the second night
item.description: DC saw violent protests in the weeks following police killing of George Floyd in back in May, and the chaos seemed to re-erupt this week with violence scenes boiling over again on Sunday.

item.title: NASA's Mars rover captures film of a 'dust devil' as it moves across the surface of the Red Planet
item.description: NASA Curiosity Rover has been moving across the Gale crater for the past eight years, conducting experiments and sending sending stunning still images to Earth.

item.title: DOLPHIN seen in Cambridgeshire river 13 MILES from the sea
item.description: Richard Priest, 32, and his wife Serena, 41, were strolling along the edge of River Nene in Wisbech, Cambridgeshire, when they spotted a fin in the water.

item.title: Rishi Sunak 'plans to axe £15bn foreign aid budget pledge'
item.description: The respected IFS think-tank said the focus for the government over the next 'couple of years' should be on propping up the economy rather than tackling the deficit.

item.title: Chilly Britons light FIRES and pull on woolly socks as temperatures plunge but crowds flock to beach
item.description: Bournemouth beach, one of the South's most popular coastal resorts, today only drew a smattering of people, in sharp comparison to the crowds who covered every inch of the sand in 2019.

item.title: Forbes Celebrity 100: Ed Sheeran leads UK stars on rich list
item.description: The Thinking Out Loud hitmaker entered the list at Number 23 with his eye-watering £47.8million ($64milllion) fortune while the Harry Potter creator placed in 28th with £44.8million ($60million)

item.title: Nicole Poturalski's jilted husband is seen for first time since she ran off with Brad Pitt
item.description: Roland Mary, 68, was pictured today for the first time since it emerged that his German model wife, 27, is dating Hollywood star Brad Pitt. Mr Mary and Nicole are said to enjoy an 'open marriage'.

item.title: Princess Diana 'left people with the feeling they mattered and were important'
item.description: May Lloyd, the widow of the former national director of The Leprosy Mission, Tony Lloyd, spoke to The Express and recalled how Princess Diana 'left people with the feeling they mattered.'

item.title: Animal lovers share the sweetest encounters they've enjoyed with furry companions
item.description: An online gallery compiled by Diply shows some of the most adorable interactions between man and beast from around the world including large dogs crushing their owners as they try to sit on their laps.

item.title: Outrage in France over 'slave' cartoon of black female politician
item.description: Valeurs Actuelles (Current Values) faces prosecution for the seven-page illustrated feature on 40-year-old Danièle Obono.

item.title: Reality stars blasted for promoting 'get-rich-quick' schemes
item.description: One guru promoted by reality stars is Jordan Heyward, 24, of Plymouth, who boasts of having more than 4,000 clients. He has been promoted by Kyle Christie, Scott Timlin, and Thomas Powell.

item.title: Inside Saudi Arabia's detention centres for migrants
item.description: Leaked images show migrants packed into cramped cells in the searing Middle East heat at Saudi prisons where they say they are 'treated like animals' and beaten by guards.

item.title: Thai king 'pardons concubine and flies her to German harem'
item.description: Playboy monarch Maha Vajiralongkorn, 68, has spent much of the pandemic in Germany with a reputed entourage of 'sex soldiers' assembled as a military unit at a four-star hotel.

item.title: Tesco removes children's doll from its stores after complaints from parents
item.description: Adam Weaver, 35, from Barry, Vale of Glamorgan, slammed the 'sexualised' doll. He said when his seven-year-old daughter opened the box she found the £23 doll dressed in lacy red underwear.

item.title: Sixteen people are infected with coronavirus at bingo night in Staffordshire
item.description: There are now 16 known cases linked to an outbreak at the Silverdale Working Men's Club on August 16, Staffordshire County Council have said.

item.title: Where are they now? FEMAIL takes a look at how previous Lottery winners have spent their fortune
item.description: FEMAIL has taken a look back at previous Lottery winners to see what they are up to now and how they decided to spent their fortune - including an Elvis impersonator who turned to binge drinking.

item.title: McDonald's HR boss David Fairhurst 'sacked for making women uncomfortable'
item.description: David Fairhurst, who was promoted to McDonald's 'chief people officer' in 2015 by fellow Brit Steve Easterbrook, was suddenly sacked last year but no reason was given for his departure.

item.title: RAF Typhoon jet escorts Ryanair plane after terror alert sounds
item.description: RAF Typhoon jets were scrambled to intercept the Lauda jet before armed police surrounded it on the runway when it landed at Stansted from Vienna at around 7.20pm yesterday.

item.title: Ranvir Singh accidentally shares personal details on live TV
item.description: The TV presenter, 43, brought her adorable dog Shmizzels onto the show, and her pet sat happily on her lap as she chatted to co-host Sean Fletcher during Monday's show.

item.title: Bill Gates makes Oreo cake for Warren Buffett's 90th birthday
item.description: Billionaire Bill Gates, 64, on Sunday shared a hilarious video on Twitter to celebrate Warren Buffett's 90th birthday. The two first met in 1991 and have stayed close for nearly three decades.

item.title: Dublin man groomed by ruthless drug lord at 10 still lives in fear
item.description: Father-of-two Joey O'Callaghan, now 35 with a new identity, was recruited by gangster Brian Kenny as a schoolboy in Blanchardstown, west Dublin.

item.title: Adele defended by stars after 'cultural appropriation' criticism
item.description: Adele has been supported by supermodel Naomi Campbell and thousands of fans after being accused of cultural appropriation for donning a Jamaican flag bikini top.

item.title: More Covid-19-like viruses to come, warns Oxford professor
item.description: Sarah Gilbert, the lead expert behind Oxford University's Covid vaccine, said modern lifestyles, intense farming and deforestation drove up the risk of outbreaks of zoonotic infections.

item.title: Nicola Sturgeon demands 'UK' is dropped from festival branding
item.description: Nicola Sturgeon's Scottish Government has objected to the working title of 'UK Festival 2022' for the event - aimed at celebrating the best of Britain.

item.title: Tatler names its hottest Social Set couples of Summer 2020
item.description: Society bible Tatler has named the hottest blue blooded couples of the summer from the British social set, which includes chocolate heiress Jemima Cadbury and Princess Margaret's grandson.

item.title: Turkey accuses Greece of 'piracy' and 'arming' an island amid dispute over energy resources
item.description: Tensions between the two countries have escalated with both sides staging military drills in the area. Kastellorizo is the island furthest removed from Greece and is 1.2 miles off the Turkish coast.

item.title: Losing weight can REVERSE most cases of type 2 diabetes
item.description: Researchers looking at half a million Britons said people appear to have a personal body max index (BMI) threshold which triggers abnormal blood sugar levels and risks causing diabetes.

item.title: At-home abortions before 10 weeks could become permanent option
item.description: Ministers are set to hold a consultation on whether to keep the system in place in England, Wales and Scotland. It allows women up to ten weeks pregnant to take abortion pills at home.

item.title: Lady Gaga, Machine Gun Kelly and Madison Beer lead the VMAs Worst Dressed List
item.description: Landing themselves on the list of the show's kookiest, quirkiest and most bizarre ensembles were stars including Lady Gaga, Machine Gun Kelly and Madison Beer during the evening of the greats

item.title: British woman is hit by a speedboat propellor and killed while swimming by the beach in Corfu
item.description: The 60-year-old woman was hit by a speedboat while swimming off Corfu and her body was discovered by other bathers, local media says.

item.title: Semi-naked man brandishes huge SWORD outside Poundland in south London
item.description: Footage shows the man, wearing just a pair of boxers, swinging the huge blade at passersby outside a Poundland near Elephant and Castle in south London yesterday.

item.title: Four in 10 who normally drive to work still working from home
item.description: A poll conducted by the AA found that 40 per cent of people who normally commuted by car remain working from home for all or some of the time.

item.title: Meghan Markle 'met Jameela Jamil a day after she called Prince Andrew an 'alleged paedophile'
item.description: Jameela Jamil, 34, said the Duke of York - Prince Harry's uncle - was the Firm's 'alleged resident pedo' on August 22. Just one day later, Jamil is believed to have travelled to the Sussex's mansion.

item.title: Mother of model who has Down's syndrome hopes one day they won't get 'weird stares'
item.description: Helen Manton, 36, from Leamington Spa, appeared on GMB to discouss her daughter's modelling stint, after the chain's talent scouts spotted the tot's modelling potential on Instagram.

item.title: Maskless customer squares up to Walmart staff after they ordered him to leave
item.description: The heated exchange took place at a Walmart in Anchorage, Alaska, on Thursday.

item.title: Map lets you track your hometown over 750 million years of Earth's history
item.description: The interactive tool was developed by Ian Webster, a former Google engineer using the PALEOMAP maps produced by geologist Christopher Scotese.

item.title: Army surveillance drone to fly over English Channel looking for migrants
item.description: The deployment of Watchkeeper drones from Lydd Airport in Kent comes after figures reveal more than 5,000 migrants have crossed the channel to the UK in small boats so far in 2020.

item.title: Erect penis will appear on TV tonight for the first time in taboo-shattering Channel 4 documentary
item.description: Channel 4's new documentary Me & My Penis, which airs at 10pm, will show footage of eight erections as men pose for naked photographs while discussing male issues.

item.title: SpaceX launches the first south bound rocket from Florida since 1969
item.description: The Falcon 9 rocket was launching an Argentinian SAOCOMB 1B satellite into polar orbit where it will monitor the Earth for signs of impending natural disasters.

item.title: Irish couple charged over stabbing attack in Sydney's east that left a man missing chunk of his ear
item.description: Neighbours found victim Oliver Solan, 30, barely conscious in a hallway at a Young Street apartment block in Randwick, in Sydney's east, about 8.40pm on Sunday.

item.title: Now push back A level and GCSE exams NEXT year, say Labour
item.description: Shadow education secretary Kate Green made the comments as Education Secretary Gavin Williamson (pictured) fights for his career by ensuing schools open successfully this week.

item.title: Father given months to live is desperately fundraising to buy his wife and toddler a home
item.description: James Roocroft, 43, from Brighton, works as a school caretaker where his home comes with his job - meaning wife Emma and two-year-old son Archie will no longer be able to live there when he's gone.

item.title: Welshman, 61, sues former employer for racism after claiming colleagues referred to 'sheep sh***ing'
item.description: James Bracegirdle is suing railway company Quinn Infrastructure Services Ltd over alleged racism. He told a tribunal how he was told his native language 'sounded like someone spewing in a bucket'.

item.title: The ultimate guide to navigating back to school
item.description: With children in England and Wales returning to school tomorrow, Femail has spoken to experts for tips on tackling anxieties, socialising with friends and getting up to speed on school work.

item.title: Fresh hope in hunt for British backpacker who vanished in Canada 31 years ago
item.description: The mother of Charles Horvath-Allan who vanished in Canada 31 years ago has been given fresh hope after a cold-case unit revealed it was investigating his disappearance.

item.title: Welsh woman, 23, left with a 'cone' of fat on bottom after a Brazilian Butt lift in Turkey
item.description: WARNING: GRAPHIC IMAGES: Shannon Davies, 23, from Pontypridd, claims Turkish surgeons botched her BBL and breast augmentation surgery, leaving her with bad scarring.

item.title: Are employees selfish if they continue to work from home?
item.description: Journlalist Sally Jones, from Warwickshire, told GMB: 'It's great for people like me, who are established with a nice garden and fine for the city boys and everyone who can do things online.'

item.title: Elephant's life is saved after it was speared and left with horrific maggot-infested wound
item.description: Sheldrick Wildlife Trust, a conservation charity in Kenya, flew by helicopter to the Mara Conservancy after visitors spotted the ailing animal.

item.title: Horrifying moment a SNAKE is pulled from a woman's throat
item.description: The creature had slithered a young woman's body as she slept in the yard of her home in Levashi village, in Dagestan, say reports.
